intro: Helipterum montanum, commonly known as the mountain helipterum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Helipterum montanum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands at elevations above 1,000 meters.
